Biography

Junbo Zhang is now an associate researcher at Microsoft Research Asia (MSRA), Beijing, China. He obtained his B.Eng. and Ph.D. degrees from the Southwest Jiaotong University, China in 2009 and 2015, respectively. Before joining MSRA, he was a Research Assistant at The Chinese University of Hong Kong, a Research Intern at Huawei Noah’s Ark Lab in Hong Kong from 2013-2015, a visiting Ph.D. student at Georgia State University from 2012-2013, and an Intern at SCK•CEN in 2011.

His research interests include deep learning, big data analytics, large-scale machine learning, and spatio-temporal data mining. He has published over 30 research papers (e.g., KDD, AAAI, IJCAI, IEEE TKDE) in refereed journals and conferences, among which one paper was selected as the ESI Hot Paper, two as the ESI Highly Cited Paper, and two as the Best Paper Award. He co-authored the book "The Principles and Methodologies of Big Data Mining—-From the Perspectives of Granular Computing and Rough Sets". Dr. Zhang received the ACM Chengdu Doctoral Dissertation Award in 2016, the Chinese Association for Artificial Intelligence (CAAI) Excellent Doctoral Dissertation Nomination Award in 2016, the Si Shi Yang Hua Medal (Top 1/1000) of SWJTU in 2012, and the Outstanding Ph.D. Graduate of Sichuan Province in 2013. He was invited to give a keynote speech at the Youth Scholars’ Forum in CRSSC‐CWI‐CGrC 2015. He is a member of IEEE, ACM, CAAI and China Computer Federation.
